title: Get Regional Hydraulic Dimensions
text: Regional hydraulic dimension relationships produced great numbers since first development approach Dunne Leopold (1978). Although regional relatiionships wide use, author aware comprehensive compilation regional hydraulic dimension relationship studies single database exists open source. RegionalCurve package seeks fill gap : * Compiling regional hydraulic relationships single database. * Providing assessor functions streamline application relationships studies.

title: Get Regional Hydraulic Dimensions
text: Early development relationships discovered dimensions bankfull width, mean bankfull depth, bankfull cross sectional area, discharge ploted drainage area log-linear. Therefore monomial relationships form \(y=ax^m\), known power functions (exponent (\(m\)) constant (\(\)) term corresponding slope intercept line (\(y = mx + b\)), appear straight lines log–log graph, adopted simplify representation relationships. standardization functional form relationships allowed approach become widely adopted conducive compliation single database. Recording two coefficients (.e., slope intercept) power function allows relationship used estimate hydraulic dimensions arbitrary drainage area (within range original study).

what: Regional Analyses Contained in this Database
title: Get Regional Hydraulic Dimensions
text: Figure 1 lists regional hydraulic dimension relationship studies included package. lists dimensions calculated regional analysis.
code: #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'region_name'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument.

title: Get Regional Hydraulic Dimensions
text: easily use data database several assessor functions created calculate estimate specified hydraulic dimension given drainage area. RHG (Regional Hydraulic Geometry) function computes hydraulic geometry dimension (cross sectional area, width, depth, discharge) built-data frame regional hydraulic equation coefficients (regional_curve). units value returned RHG function depend requested dimension (see RHG function help details). case, requested dimension width, units feet. determine regions available, regional_curve data frame can queried. list regions can used determine regions contained database input region string value use RHG function. determined region use, need determine dimensions study derived relationship . studies derive relationships hydraulic dimensions. can see, area, width, depth available. Discharge derived study.

Although regional relationships wide use, authors aware comprehensive compilation regional hydraulic dimension relationship studies single database exists open source. RegionalCurve package seeks fill gap : Compiling regional hydraulic relationships single database. Providing assessor functions streamline application relationships studies.

code: # View the vignettes in a web browser browseVignettes("RegionalCurve")  # Open a specific vignette in the RStudio help window vignette("Get_Regional_Hydraulic_Dimensions")

RHG (Regional Hydraulic Geometry) function computes hydraulic geometry dimension (cross sectional area, width, depth, discharge) built-data frame regional hydraulic equation coefficients (regional_curve). units value returned RHG function depend requested dimension (see RHG function help details). case, requested dimension width, units feet. determine regions available, regional_curve data frame can queried. list regions can used determine regions contained database input region string value use RHG function. determined region use, need determine dimensions study derived relationship . studies derive relationships hydraulic dimensions. can see, area, width, depth available. Discharge derived study.
code: # Calculate the discharge for a 200 sq mi watershed in Massachusetts. RHG(region = "MA", drainageArea = 200,   dimensionType = "width") # Determine the available regions levels(regional_curve$region_name) # Determine which dimensions were calculated for the Eastern United States region regional_curve[regional_curve$region_name == "Eastern United States", c("dimension")]

title: A Collection of Hydraulic Regional Curve Relationships

what: Computes regional hydraulic geometry dimensions — RHG
title: Computes regional hydraulic geometry dimensions — RHG
text: Computes regional hydraulic geometry (RHG) dimension (cross sectional area, width, depth, discharge) built-table regional hydraulic geometry equation coefficients.

title: Computes regional hydraulic geometry dimensions — RHG
code: RHG(   region,   drainageArea,   dimensionType = c("area", "depth", "width", "discharge") )

title: Computes regional hydraulic geometry dimensions — RHG
text: region character; region dimension calculated . complete list regions, see levels(regional_curve$region_name) drainageArea numeric; upstream drainage area location dimension (square miles). dimensionType character; Dimension type: "area", "depth", "width", "discharge"

title: Computes regional hydraulic geometry dimensions — RHG
text: numeric value requested hydraulic dimension. units dimensions follows: area: square feet, depth: feet, width: feet, discharge: cubic feet per second

title: Computes regional hydraulic geometry dimensions — RHG
text: function uses values regional_curve data frame calculate hydraulic geometry dimensions. Monomial relationships form \(y=ax^m\), known power functions, appear straight lines log–log graph, exponent (m) constant (\(\)) term corresponding slope intercept line (\(y = mx + b\)).

title: Computes regional hydraulic geometry dimensions — RHG
code: # Calculate the discharge for a 200 sq mi watershed in Massachusetts. RHG(region = "MA", drainageArea = 200, dimensionType = "discharge") #> [1] 2568.641  # Calculate the discharge for a 200 sq mi watershed in Massachusetts. RHG(region        = c("MA","MA","MA", "MA"),     drainageArea  = c(200, 200, 200, 200),     dimensionType = c("width", "depth", "area", "discharge")) #> [1]  127.777893    4.559528  583.986783 2568.640853

what: Compute Hydraulic Geometry From Graph — RHG_graph
title: Compute Hydraulic Geometry From Graph — RHG_graph
text: Computes hydraulic dimension (cross sectional area, width, depth) built-table regional hydraulic curve graph coordinates.

title: Compute Hydraulic Geometry From Graph — RHG_graph
code: RHG_graph(region, drainageArea, dimensionType)

title: Compute Hydraulic Geometry From Graph — RHG_graph
text: region character; region dimension calculated . See regional_curves$region field complete list. drainageArea numeric; upstream drainage area location dimension (square miles). dimensionType character; dimension type: "area", "depth", "width"

title: Compute Hydraulic Geometry From Graph — RHG_graph
text: value requested hydraulic dimension

title: Compute Hydraulic Geometry From Graph — RHG_graph
text: Used internally convert historic studies report regional relationships using "power function" convention.

title: Compute Hydraulic Geometry From Graph — RHG_graph
code: # Calculate the cross sectional area for a watershed with drainage area = 1 # square mile in the Eastern United States region. RHG_graph(region = "Eastern United States",           drainageArea = 1,           dimensionType = "area") #> [1] 23

title: Compute power function coefficients — RHG_graph_coefficients
text: Computes regional curve power function coefficients table regional hydraulic curve coordinates contained built-table.

title: Compute power function coefficients — RHG_graph_coefficients
code: RHG_graph_coefficients(region, drainageArea, dimensionType)

title: Compute power function coefficients — RHG_graph_coefficients
text: region character; region dimension calculated . See regional_curves$region field complete list. drainageArea numeric; upstream drainage area location dimension (square miles). dimensionType character; dimension type: "area", "depth", "width"

title: Compute power function coefficients — RHG_graph_coefficients
text: data frame containing value slope (\(m\)) intercept (\(\)) requested region hydraulic dimension.

title: Compute power function coefficients — RHG_graph_coefficients
text: Regional curves typically displayed log-log plots. method required extract formula calculating y-axis value graphs (.e., cross-sectional area, width, mean depth) x-axis value (.e., drainage area). Monomial relationships form \(y=ax^m\), known power functions, appear straight lines log–log graph, exponent (m) constant (\(\)) term corresponding slope intercept line (\(y = mx + b\)).
code: Used internally to convert historic studies that do not report regional relationships using the "power function" convention.

title: Compute power function coefficients — RHG_graph_coefficients
code: # Calculate the slope and intercept for a watershed with drainage area = 1 # square mile in the Eastern United States region. RHG_graph_coefficients(region = "Eastern United States",                        drainageArea = 1,                        dimensionType = "area") #>                  region drainageArea dimensionType         m  a #> 1 Eastern United States            1          area 0.6602316 23 #>                rc.source #> 1 Dunne & Leopold (1978)

what: RegionalCurve: A Collection of Hydraulic Regional Curve Relationships — RegionalCurve-package
title: RegionalCurve: A Collection of Hydraulic Regional Curve Relationships — RegionalCurve-package
text: Data studies delineate regional hydraulic geometry relationships. data compiled wide range studies single table provide comprehensive one-stop source. Accessor functions also included streamline application dimensions analyses visualizations.

title: RegionalCurve: A Collection of Hydraulic Regional Curve Relationships — RegionalCurve-package
text: Maintainer: Michael Dougherty Michael.P.Dougherty@usace.army.mil (ORCID) Authors: Christopher Haring Christopher.P.Haring@usace.army.mil

title: Check Dimension Type — check_dimensionType
text: Check determine valid dimension type supplied.

title: Check Dimension Type — check_dimensionType
code: check_dimensionType(dimensionType)

title: Check Dimension Type — check_dimensionType
text: dimensionType character; vector dimension type. Must contain following values: "area", "depth", "width", "discharge"

title: Check Dimension Type — check_dimensionType
text: Returns TRUE vector dimension types contain valid values.

title: Check Regions — check_regions
text: Checks parameter listed package data frame regional_curve$region_name.

title: Check Regions — check_regions
code: check_regions(regions)

title: Check Regions — check_regions
text: regions character vector; vector regions listed package data frame regional_curve$region_name.

title: Check Regions — check_regions
text: Returns TRUE regions parameter listed package data frame regional_curve$region_name.

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_dimension_graph
text: Creates Regional Hydraulic Dimension graph regions provided specified dimension.

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_dimension_graph
code: region_dimension_graph(   regions,   dimension_type = c("area", "depth", "width", "discharge") )

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_dimension_graph
text: regions character; vector region names displayed graph. complete list regions, see levels(regional_curve$region_name) RegionalCurve::regional_curve$region_name. dimension_type character; Dimension type: "area", "depth", "width", "discharge"

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_dimension_graph
text: ggplot object.

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_dimension_graph
text: Creates regional hydraulic dimension graph styled using conventions emerged fluvial geomorphic literature: Drainage Area independent variable x-axis. Units expressed imperial units (square miles). Hydraulic dimensions (.e., width, depth, cross sectional area, discharge) dependent variables y-axis. Units expressed imperial units(.e, width: feet, depth: feet, cross sectional area: square feet, discharge: cubic feet per second). axes log scale (aka "log-log graph").

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_dimension_graph
code: regions = c("Minnesota Eastern", "Minnesota Western") dimension_type = "width" region_dimension_graph(regions, dimension_type)   region_dimension_graph(regions, "depth")

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_graph
text: Creates Regional Hydraulic Dimension graph regions provided specified dimension.

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_graph
code: region_graph(regions, dimension_types)

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_graph
text: regions character; vector region names displayed graph. complete list regions, see levels(regional_curve$region_name) RegionalCurve::regional_curve$region_name. dimension_types character; vector dimension types: "area", "depth", "width", "discharge"

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_graph
text: ggplot object.

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_graph
text: Creates regional hydraulic dimension graph styled using conventions emerged fluvial geomorphic literature: Drainage Area independent variable x-axis. Units expressed imperial units (square miles). Hydraulic dimensions (.e., width, depth, cross sectional area, discharge) dependent variables y-axis. Units expressed imperial units(.e, width: feet, depth: feet, cross sectional area: square feet, discharge: cubic feet per second). Dependent variables (y-axes) stacked dependent variable (x-axis). axes log scale (aka "log-log graph").

title: Region Dimension Graph — region_graph
code: regions = c("Minnesota Eastern", "Minnesota Western") dimension_types = c("width", "depth", "area") region_graph(regions, dimension_types)

what: Calculate Region Minimum and Maximum Dimensions — region_min_max
title: Calculate Region Minimum and Maximum Dimensions — region_min_max
text: Calculates regional hydraulic dimensions minimum maximum drainage area values provided region.

title: Calculate Region Minimum and Maximum Dimensions — region_min_max
code: region_min_max(regions)

title: Calculate Region Minimum and Maximum Dimensions — region_min_max
text: regions character; vector region names displayed graph. complete list regions, see levels(regional_curve$region_name) RegionalCurve::regional_curve$region_name.

title: Calculate Region Minimum and Maximum Dimensions — region_min_max
text: data frame.

title: Calculate Region Minimum and Maximum Dimensions — region_min_max
code: regions = c("Minnesota Eastern", "Minnesota Western") df <- region_min_max(regions)

what: Regional hydraulic geometry curve data — regional_curve
title: Regional hydraulic geometry curve data — regional_curve
text: dataset containing regional hydraulic geometry curve data streams North America. variables dataset follows:

title: Regional hydraulic geometry curve data — regional_curve
code: regional_curve

title: Regional hydraulic geometry curve data — regional_curve
text: data frame 163 observations 11 variables: region_name name region state name US state Canadian province dimension name hydraulic dimension (area, depth, , discharge) intercept y-intercept regional equation slope slope regional equation r_squared goodness fit statistic model no_sites number sites used create model drainage_area_range range drainage areas considered model (square miles) recurrence_range flood recurrence interval (years) median_recurrence median flood recurrence (years) reference citation study

title: Get Regional Curves — regional_curves
text: Returns data frame regional_curve package data.

title: Get Regional Curves — regional_curves
code: regional_curves()

title: Get Regional Curves — regional_curves
text: data frame regional_curve package data.

title: Get Regional Curves — regional_curves
code: rc <- regional_curves()

title: RegionalCurve v0.1.6 (Release date: 2023-09-07)
text: Upgraded RHG function handle vectorized inputs produce vectorized outputs. Added several new graphing functions comparing regional curves described new vignette. Added new function calculate hydraulic dimensions region min max drainage areas covered study. data frame required describe compare regional curves. Added package security checks using R package oysteR.

title: RegionalCurve v0.1.6 (Release date: 2023-09-07)
text: None
